newsitem.title: USA: ITT to sell North American aftermarket unit. [corrected 22:05 gmt]
newsitem.headline: ITT to sell North American aftermarket unit. [corrected 22:05 gmt]

text.p: ITT Automotive, a unit of ITT Industries Inc., said Tuesday it is selling its North American Aftermarket division to Echlin Inc. for undisclosed terms.
ITT Industries was the manufacturing unit of ITT Corp., which is fighting a hostile takeover bid from Hilton Hotels Corp., until it was spun off in 1996. (Corrects reference to ITT Corp.)
The ITT Automotive unit will operate as Aimco Products Inc., a division of Echlin's North American Aftermarket Operations. The unit's annual sales are about $140 million.
ITT, based in Auburn Hills, Mich., said it will continue to own and operate its after-market unit in Europe. (Corrects location of headquarters.)
Echlin, based in Branford, Conn., is a worldwide supplier of automotive products.
ITT Automotive's's stock fell 25 cents to $24.625 (corrects stock price), and Echlin was unchanged at $32.75, both on the New York Stock Exchange.
